column4: if noone here knows where i can get help any ideas were i should go?
you have another sound application running, probably in OSS mode
disabling ESD in Sys-Preferences-Sound can also be helpful
kubuntu doesn't use esd as far as I know... is it artsd? There must be some sound preference panel in KDE, too
see if you have artsd running: 'ps ax | grep artsd' in konsole
it's not running then. Sorry, I don't know what could be blocking your audio device.
repeat your question. If you don't get a reply, it's okay to repeat it after 10 or 15 minutes.
how is that going to get it to install?
you asked about fixing xorg.conf
ask the bot?
i cant install ubuntu from the live cd when i fixed it the first time someone linked me to a tutorial that said something about the xorg.conf file
how far do you get?
were you booting from the CD at the time?
yes
have you tried the Safe Graphics option?
yes
when you get to that blue screen, see if you can switch to a console with Ctrl-Alt-F1. If so, you can run 'sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg', which calls a wizard for reconfiguring xorg.conf
failing that, I suggest you download the Alternate CD, which has a text-based installer
I'll leave you in the capable hands of leo_rockw. Thanks leo_rockw
forget it -- if he's got console access, he'll get in and read your data somehow. Locks help, and threats of violence do too, in some cases ;)
a plain text editor -- gedit is easy, I prefer emacs
macrobad: thank you
